Name: Statue of Shepses-Ptah
Description: The figure, dressed in a gala kilt, is standing with its legs together on a high rectangular base. The back pillar reaches as high as the lower edge of the shoulder-length wig. The upper part of the body is turned to the left; the head is slightly inclined to the left as well.There are some traces of paint: red-brown on the body and black on the back pillar. The surface of the statue shows shallow depressions caused by a chisel.
